results.title: Victoria University Student Collection 2001
results.brief_description:
CD ROM work provided by Victoria University of exemplary work produced by students in their multimedia courses.

This interactive CD Rom and website documentary explores the life and music of virtuoso guitarist Slava Grigoryan.

The website and CD ROM hybrid allows for regular updates and particularly suited to the work as the guitarist travels frequently and can list concert and publication updates.

results.title: Victoria Howlett: potter
results.creator_credit: Nina Syme, Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Victoria Howlett regards her pottery as a reflection of her personality, her travels and her various experiences. She finds inspiration for her work in nature and approaches her tasks very systematically.

results.title: Victoria changing faces changing places
results.brief_description: This short documentary addresses the issues that surround Victoria’s growing population, whilst also probing the past and how migration helped shaped the current demographic. Using voice-over narration, this features an array of archival footage to examine the underlying drivers of population growth, with a view to understanding how the community is changing, and the what the future is likely to hold for Victoria.

results.title: Victoria : The First 150 Years
results.creator_credit: Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria
results.brief_description: An overview of Victoria covering its history, culture and landscape. Gold, sport, bushfires and rural Victoria are amongst the subjects covered and there is also a significant use of historical film footage in this description of Victoria.

results.title: Victoria's welcome to press delegates
results.brief_description: Viscount Burnham is welcomed by S.S. Argyle, M.L.A. Chief Secretary of Victoria. Items of interest are pointed out, indicating Victoria’s development as a state including footage of Sir John Monash, development of the Hume Weir, Yallourn Open Cut mine, the Dandenong Ranges/Ferntree Gully, Yarra Glen, Camperdown, Rochester, the “Better Farming Train”, Bendigo, Geelong and Geelong Grammar, and Ballarat. Source: National Film and Sound Archive.

results.title: Victoria's first settlers
results.creator_credit: Lili Steiner and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The state historian of Victoria Mr Bernard Barrett talks to Trevor Lunn about Victoria’s Aboriginal past, the first British visitors, sealers and whalers and the settlements at Portland and Melbourne.

results.title: Victoria's Favourite Things. Segment 9
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘Victoria’s Favourite Things’. This segment features Maya and her fairy costume; Jennifer from Regent talks about Bernadette and Lucinda; Kieran from St Kilda loves football; Kay has a favourite hat and scarf; and Monica from Avondale Heights talks about Meditation.
